alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Charleston; Colleton; Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Charleston, Colleton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 308 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area across the corridors of Savannah Highway, Maybank Highway, and Highway 174. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area by 4 PM. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaufort, Port Royal, Johns Island, West Ashley, James Island, Clarendon, Hollywood, Ravenel, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Rockville, Bennetts Point, Ashepoo, Jacksonboro, Adams Run, Green Pond, Edisto Island, Dale and Ladys Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
